author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1524346391}
review:
Tags: 1PSurv - First Person Survival
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Empty procedurally generated game with a few seeded activities. Deerhunt island. Pirate Hunt Island. Most of them mostly barren with one random NPC on it.

There are, I presume two ways of going about playing this .The one method that involves using craft material to climb up the tech ladder seems to not really be viable. You always do need to find a lootstash or lootbox to find some of the core components and tools. For example, I do not believe it possible to make a pickaxe as no stones are lying around.

Pirates just charge forward and clip into each other as they clumsily swing and you clumsily swing back. It is a simple hit and get hit affair with a largely useless block function as you still take damage while blocking and aggroing more than one pirate means they deathball togeher making blocking really hard to time or use at all.

Activities in islands sometimes involve clearing a few deers, killing a few pirates etc, at which point a reward unlocks. This to me sounds the more viable option as the rewards are often in gold which allows you to buy things from merchants that you would have trouble getting on your own.

The thing is the raft you use to get between islands is a tad annoying to use, in addition, I beached the raft and no matter how much I tried I could not push it back into water despite pressing the appropriate keys and being very patient about it.

That left me swimming from island to island which was not satisfying or effective.

I found a pirate map, and a compass, I assume I would have needed a sextant and other things to actually be able to track my position and triangulate where to go. Which would possibly add some kind of a geocaching element to the game albeit an uncommon, and rather rare one.

When you take into consideration that hunting involves hitting a deer with an arrow upwards of 4 or 5 times and chasing them around all over. That fruit trees are not a very common source of food, and that getting trapped at night without a campfire or torch means that you are stuck waiting for the night to cycle away, staring at a pitch black screen that makes any gameplay impossible it makes you wonder if the few survival elements that were included were really thought out all that well.

Conclusion: Even if a lot of things were added in, I do not think that the core elements of gameplay are fluid enough, the crafting is clunky, survival is badly handled, combat is a clunky clusterflock and I found the setting somewhat bland and not very piratey after all. For that reason, it would not be a recommendable title even if it was brimming with content. But as things stand now I would strongly advise to steer clear. This is a walking simulator mroe than anything else. It would be best for me to remove it to the library of hidden titles and remove local content permanently as this is no longer in Early Access and it is safe to assume that gameplay will not fundamentally change.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972788776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 5058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1665607145}
review:
I'm gonna keep this short. I really like this game. Don't expect a huge resources gathering game like minecraft. Each island has a small amount of resources forcing you to explore other islands. Just one thing, craft a sextant and a compass. It's necessary to chart out the map and find stuff. I got lucky, I found a compass in a chest and only had to craft the sextant.  

Don't really wanna explain the game so just discover yourself.  You'll get the hang of it pretty fast. It's quite relaxing too!

If you like exploration, finding stuff with some fighting, hunting, fishing all this with quests then It's worth a look. 

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982567490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1523681765}
review: This game is no good at all. Certainly not ready to have left early access already. Clicking "New Game" simply dumps you into the middle of an island with no explanation or even intro. The game is extremely resource-intensive, moreso than Fallout 4, despite having graphics appropriate for something ten years ago. There is really no reason to give this game a shot, just another quick cash-grab by devs who don't care about releasing a complete product, let alone a good one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319309055', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1610248471}
review:
de lo poco que jugue puedo decir que es un juego lento pero entretenido y con amigos mucho mejor el explorar es la base (y enojarse con el cartografo que te dice que el mapa esta mal) pero lo mejor del juego son las tumbas son unas risas aseguradas desde el capitan que se comio su loro en tiempos dificiles hasta el que se murio por vever demaciada agua salada  por lo demas los personajes son feos pero no desentonan con el ambiente y su punto fuerte es que tu tienes que hacer el mapa los barcos requieren bastantes materiales y el mundo es tuyo 
lo malo a mi parecer es la poca fauna y poca optimizacion

author: {'steamid': '76561197989789853', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7875, 'last_played': 1602086981}
review:
Looked this up after reading an RPS feature suggesting it was quite a relaxed survival game. And they were right, it is.

As a fledgling pirate, you wake up on an island with the gear to make a raft and little else. From there on out, it's really up to you what you do. There is a quest line and side quests given to you by various NPCs but, if you simply want to go island hopping (make your own map!), or fishing (catch rare fish!), or take on bands of pirates with your sword or bow (die after being overwhelmed when your gung-ho approach fails spectacularly!), you can.

The graphics are, I would say, functional compared with, say, Sea of Thieves (which I only mention as something vaguely comparable gameplay-wise), but they have a charm all of their own. And besides which, it's gameplay that really counts and if you like the idea of a first person pirating game with light survival mechanics, this may be for you (give the demo a go!).

I should say that I've only played singleplayer and there is a multiplayer option which I've no doubt is fun; playing with a friend/friends usually is after all. Once again, if you're not sure, try the demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432464527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2756, 'last_played': 1552025779}
review:
I have to be honest, I actually started to like SALT. It's atmosphere was great, super peaceful with plenty of pretty sights, and enough content to get you hooked before running into some flaws. I loved the exploration aspect of it, it was fun making use of your sextant to plot out islands on your map.

     However, now we get to my major gripe with the game: The combat, I cannot stress enough that the combat in this game is a complete and total pile of trash, it's like they looked into EA's chamber pot of fecal combat systems, took a butter knife, scraped out the very bottom of the pot, slapped a shiny 'dodge!' and 'parry!' sticker on it and prayed no-one would notice that it was just a month old turd. The whole thing detracts greatly from enjoying the exploration of the game. 

    The combat itself basically ends up boiling down to: if your weapon has higher numbers than their weapon, and you have armor with high numbers, and have enough health potions, then you win! No skill, just numbers. 

    It appears they tried to make it skill based adding a 'dodge' mechanic and a 'block' and 'parry' mechanic, but the are so pin-point precise that they end up relying on luck. The enemy attacks have no indication of when they will hit you and they home in on you like guided missile, if you dodge too soon during their attack, they'll just turn on a dime and hit you in mid-air. Blocking only lessens the damage you take, and you just barely have enough time to get a single attack in, making doing damage more worth while.  

    Parrying theoretically will momentarily stun them, giving you a large opening for attack. But after experimenting on a weak enemy for about 30 minutes, I could not find when the right time to parry is, and concluded that it is completely random, with me only getting lucky twice in a ocean of failures.  

but after moaning an whining about the combat for hours I thought "Well hey, the games in early access and they're a small team, they'll fix it eventually right?"...

Yeah, and then it left early access, the devs essentially said "we hope none of you actually thought we where going to finish making our game, because we're only going to to minor updates bug fixes from now on. [b] cough [/b] if you're lucky [b] cough [/b].‚Äù

    And I didn't even say anything about the lack of stuff to do out at actual sea, sure there's treasures you can find, but that just about as fun as removing each and every one of you nose hairs while hanging upside-down from slowly rotating ceiling fan.

    Your ship is more of a glorified storage locker on which you are completely out of danger, nothing can happen to you when you are on your ship, there is no threat, you can't beach your ship or sink it, there are no enemy pirates or sharks or anything that would pose the least amount of threat to you while your at sea.. nothing!

    But I wanted to say that I did have a lot of fun just exploring islands, finding new quests and items. I kinda just ended up relaxing entered a trance of exploration that sucked up my time before being pimp-slapped out of it by it's ugly and jarring combat system. Then only to find out that the devs abandoned the game with it's many flaws and bugs.

         So, my final verdict is this: If it's on sale, consider picking it up, but you will probably regret buying this at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033107343', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1521194433}
review: This game is a really interesting gem, although I will admit, it has it's small issues, they are just small, if you really wanted a minecraft styled game that fits more for exploration and such, this is the game to go for, that being said, it is fairly unique, and I happen to have a lot of fun with it. I honestly look forward to a sequel where it's nearly the same, but they really improve things, and offer new ships, and other things like it. Never have I met a sailing game that felt more genuine and interesting, they have combat, but it's not the main focus, and I think that's what really makes this great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082229691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8590, 'last_played': 1687913216}
review:
I've played quite a bit and I've really loved the game! I got this game on sale while in Early Access and was always eager to play new updates, which were quite frequent. However more recently the game has come out as a full release, and the devs no longer update it. On sale for around 8$ (CAD), with frequent updates, this game was a steal. Unfortunately, at its now full price of 17.49$ (CAD), I can't really recommend it. This game had so much potential and charm it breaks my heart to see it stay in its current state. 

I could always look past the shortcomings of the game when it was in Early Access but when they announced it was finished, I was really disappointed. For the great times I've had I'll leave a positive review, I mean, it's a really cool game. Just be wary of the price versus what you're getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058882982', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1520820285}

It seems like the developers have gotten bored of this game and are now moving onto a new title unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090257049', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1552197371}
review: after having played for a decent amount of time the best way i could describe this game is like an elder scrolls game at sea with light survival crafting elements (and by light i mean very light). theres no levelling system or skill tree or anything like that but what i mean is the atmosphere of the game feels that way, you grab a book and read about some dude that found some stone ruin with a cursed structure on the inside and you can go find that place and raid it(and perhaps try to activate the stone if you so please). or you follow a beacon and find an inn where you can then pick up quests to do, theres npcs that litter the map that also give you quests or that you can trade with, and all of that makes for quite a unique experience which is different from other ocean based survival crafting games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182322479', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7411, 'last_played': 1613243682}
review:
I usually don't write comments for games,but this game is different.I started to play it when it came out but then i didn't have much money so my friend helped me.For me this game was so cool, because i like pirate games and ships,so this was very good experience to me.With every update game gets better and better,on this profile i played it 119 hours and i didn't do everything because it has soo much of good gameplay for only 19.99‚Ç¨, I bought it when it was 14.99‚Ç¨. When I started to play I was like wtf how do I collect wood xD and then i realize i need to pick it up form ground,it was long time ago...
I really reccomend this game it don't cost too much but it brings many & many hours of playing.
Very well done  job creating this game 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039196983', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3368, 'last_played': 1517206127}
review: I really enjoy this game. It's nice and relaxed, not too difficult. The perfect sandbox game. The idea of clearing a few pirates or deer on an island makes the game great. It gives each and every island purpose without making you feel the need to grind things out. I have found one of the main story quests to be buggy and uncompletable, but this is more for exploring and ship building anyway. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992058769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1518335102}
review:
I had high hopes for Salt when it entered EA as it felt like it had a lot of potential. Unfortunately that potential was never realised and in its current state Salt is severley lacking in polish and depth. 

Gameplay mainly conists of sailing between islands to collect sticks and rocks. Occasionally taking a fetch quest . Clicking on pirates until they die and some fishing. 

The fishing is a good example of what Salt is missing. The fishing gameplay is similar to Minecraft except without the polish. For a nautically themed game that costs this much I'd expect something similar to Stardew Valley at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023332554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 5538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4357, 'last_played': 1522350455}
review:
[h1]Gutes Survival-Multiplayerspiel mit Macken (Wert 10‚Ç¨)[/h1]

[b]Kurzbeschreibung[/b]

Salt ist ein Survival-Abenteuer-Spiel, bei dem der Spieler Pirat bzw. Abenteurer ist. Es gibt ein Hauptquestlinie und verschiedene Nebenquestlinien, die man erf√ºllen kann. Das kann man entweder gezielt tun oder wie das typisch f√ºr OpenWorld-Spiele ist, einfach nebenbei. Die Questgeber trifft man dabei immer wieder und auch die Orte f√ºr Quests wiederholen sich. Es gibt dabei im Laufe des Spiels einen sp√ºhrbaren Fortschritt, der sich daran bemerkbar macht, dass sowohl die eigene Ausr√ºstung, als auch die Gegner schwerer werden. Auch bei Nebent√§tigkeiten wie Angeln oder Jagen macht man mit der Zeit durch Ausr√ºstung Fortschritte und es geht einfacher. Bei mir macht sich das vor allem beim Jagen deutlich bemerkbar - wo am Anfang die Rehe noch weggerannt sind und ich sie dann anhand ihrer Spuren wiederfinden musste, kann ich ihnen heute mit der passenden Ausr√ºstung hinterherlaufen und sogar mit dem Messer anstatt dem Bogen erlegen. Diese Ausr√ºstung ist dabei nur f√ºr diese T√§tigkeiten wirklich gut geeignet, f√ºr Kampf benutze ich eine andere Ausr√ºstung, die ich aber mit einem Klick und dank endlosem Inventar leicht wechseln kann.

[b]Was ist gut?[/b]
[list]
[*]Multiplayer I - dieses Spiel l√§sst sich einfach im MP spielen und Freunde k√∂nnen jederzeit hinzukommen und wieder gehen auch wenn sie vielleicht einen anderen Fortschritt in Sachen Quests und Ausr√ºstung haben
[*]Open World - die Welt ist wirklich gro√ü und man wird wohl nie alles erforschen aber es macht echt viel Spa√ü von Insel zu Insel  zu segeln, zu Navigieren und zu Kartographieren (ja ihr m√ºsst eure leere Karte selbst f√ºllen und bekommt daf√ºr im Laufe des Spiels auch bessere Gegenst√§nde und Funktionen hinzu)
[*]Grafik - die ist, auch wenn recht einfach, durch die Beleuchtung doch ziemlich sch√∂n
[*]Atmosph√§re - haben die Entwickler wirklich sehr gut eingefangen, man f√ºhlt sich wirklich als Abenteurer, der durch die Meere reist - durch B√ºcher und Quests wird die Welt auch ausreichend lebendig und erh√§lt mehr Tiefe
[*]Multiplayer II - Sehr sch√∂n ist auch, dass es im MP um die Ressourcen keine Konkurrenz gibt (jeder bekommt z.B. das Holz und gleichzeitig ist Loot von z.B. toten Piraten zuf√§llig, wodurch es eben doch Unterschiede zwischen den Spielern gibt) - Au√üerdem ist es gut, dass man die Map mit gleichem Seed einfach weiter im Singleplayer spielen kann, so kann ein Mitspieler zum Beispiel einfach schon mal weiterreisen und an besonderen Orten dann auf die anderen warten und sie einladen (der Spieler muss dabei noch nichtmal der Host sein)
[/list]

[b]Was neutral zu werten?[/b]
[list]
[*]Das Spiel ist nur in Englisch verf√ºgbar, aber die Texte sind leicht zu verstehen
[*]Crafting - zweckm√§√üig auch wenn es irgendwie sehr schade ist, dass man Ressourcen wie Bambus oder Holz nur finden und nicht richtig abbauen kann - bei Bambus m√ºsst ihr auf die dunkelgr√ºnen Bambusst√§be achten, die zwischen den normalen Dekost√§ben sind!
[*]Schiffe/Basen - Basen auf Inseln k√∂nnt ihr nicht bauen, macht auch keinen Sinn, aber eure Schiffe dienen als Basen, allerdings braucht ihr nicht unbedingt ein gro√ües Schiff mit Kisten, Kanonen etc. euer Inventar ist endlos und Kisten auf einem Schiff braucht man nur um √ºberfl√ºssigen Loot oder Dinge, die ihr grad nicht braucht zu lagern, damit euer Inventar wieder √ºbersichtlich ist - im Endeffekt ist ein gro√ües Schiff einfach nur ein Statussymbol - praktisch werdet ihr meist mit dem kleinen Segler fahren
[*]Musik - ist OK
[*]Grinding - eigentlich typisch f√ºr diese Spiele und am Anfang eher unsch√∂n, sp√§ter l√§uft es aber einfach nebenbei und geht gef√ºhlt auch wesentlich schneller
[*]Kampfsystem - ist OK, Blocken und Ausweichen ist manchmal sinnvoll, im MP reicht aber einfach draufhauen
[*]alle NPCs sind nur auf Inseln zu finden, nicht auf Schiffen und andere Schiffe liegen immer vor Anker, der Ozean wirkt dadurch extrem leer. Es w√§re nett wenn wenigstens hin und wieder ein Schiff mit Piraten zu sehen w√§re, muss ja nicht fahren aber irgendwo auf dem Ozean mal ein anderes Schiff w√§re nett gewesen.
[/list]




[b]Was ist eher negativ zu werten?[/b]
[list]
[*]Das Spiel wirkt unfertig und h√§tte noch ein wenig Entwicklung vertragen (Quality of Life-Improvements wie bessere Sortierung im Inventar oder Cheat-Konsole falls mal ein Bug dein Savegame zers√∂rt w√§ren sch√∂n, au√üerdem gibt es wohl Inhalte, die noch nicht wirklich funktionieren oder zumindest nicht zu Ende entwickelt wurden)
[*]Es gibt hin und wieder [b]Bugs[/b] die dein Spiel zum Absturz bringen und wir hatten auch bereits einen Bug, bei dem das komplette Inventar verloren ging, h√§tten wir nicht meins r√ºberkopieren k√∂nnen, dann w√§re das sehr sehr frustrierend geworden.
[*]Ebenso schade sind Bugs bei Booten, wir hatten einen, wo wir richtig weit weg geschleudert wurden, weil die Boote mit den Spielern gebuggt haben - seitdem fahren wir nur noch einzeln und es w√§re wirklich sch√∂n zusammen auf einem gro√üen Schiff zu fahren - das w√ºrde definitv mehr Spielspa√ü bringen.
[/list]



[b]Fazit[/b]
Salt ist ein sch√∂nes, atmosph√§risches Survival-Abenteuer-Spiel und wenn ihr es mit Freunden spielen wollt, dann w√ºrde ich es unbedingt empfehlen, wenn euch das Setting anspricht. Durch die Bugs und teilweise fehlenden oder unfertig wirkenden Inhalte w√ºrde ich nicht viel mehr als 10‚Ç¨ daf√ºr ausgeben. Wir haben fast 50h in Salt und immernoch Spa√ü. Die Kritik in einigen Reviews hier ist berechtigt, es wirkt teilweise wirklich als w√§re es zu fr√ºh aus dem EA rausgekommen, allerdings sind die postiven Bewertungen von vor dem Release eben nicht ohne Grund da. Die aktuelle Welle der Kritik kommt √ºberwiegend von Spielern die vom vielleicht zu fr√ºhen Release entt√§uscht sind. Wer Salt aber noch gar nicht kennt kann nicht derart entt√§uscht werden. So geht es mir und darum empfehle ich es auch.

7/10
8/10 im MP

author: {'steamid': '76561198046743901', 'num_games_owned': 2698, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1558148013}
review:
[h1]TL;DR at Bottom[/h1]
[b]Check out my [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjTq9HTQ19VhvYU-u4fOmNg?]Youtube channel[/url] for hilarious playthroughs of other such games![/b]

[h1]Verdict :[/h1]
[b][i]If nautical nonsense is something you wish, then buy Salt; Recommended Purchase[/i][/b]

[h1]Crawling From the Deep[/h1]

There‚Äôs plenty of open-world survival games out there on the market, but not too many of them actually manage to slither from the absolute hellhole that is Steam Early Access. Salt miraculously did just that, and I think as such it‚Äôs definitely worthy of a look at the very least. It‚Äôs a game about naval exploration back in the time of pirates and swashbuckling adventures, and as such has a massive focus on naval exploration. Coincidentally that‚Äôs also my favorite part of the game, all the nautical nonsense that can be done with little more than a raft and copious amounts of ambition. Before I decide to nosedive into the game as a whole, I‚Äôd like to address some of the obvious problems that may turn potential buyers away at the doors. The biggest of these is the graphics, and more specifically, the player models themselves. Now, I didn‚Äôt experience this to as bad a degree considering I played alone and as such didn‚Äôt really interact with too many other people, but it‚Äôs clearly a problem. It‚Äôs definitely a sad state of things when I can best compare your models to those present in Roblox, and there seems to have been absolutely zero work put into them at all. It‚Äôs extremely disorienting, going from island to island in your swashbuckling escapades, killing wildlife and exploring jungles, only to be interrupted at first sight of one of the aforementioned disfigured monstrosities. Not only did it take me out of the experience, it honestly just made me laugh, and that‚Äôs not really what you want your player to be feeling when they‚Äôre in the middle of combat or attempting to uncover story. On top of the hilariously horrendous player and NPC models, another issue is that of the combat. It‚Äôs not particularly good, however it also isn‚Äôt particularly bad in any way either. That‚Äôs the problem though, it just feels like it could have been more than it currently is. Like there was a pool of potential for these devs, but even over the course of a little over three years they still managed to ignore it. I have no real problems with how the combat is now, it‚Äôs definitely functional and, in some cases, a lot of fun. However in a game where I found myself fighting fairly often, it‚Äôs pathetic that the only real options for attacking are to hit them, and to hit them slightly harder. 

[h1]Cartography and Carnage[/h1]

Both the player models and the overly basic combat are minor complaints in an otherwise well-rounded adventure game. In the patch released when they pulled Salt out of early access they also added a main story, however I ignored it almost instantly and instead chose to head island to island in search of plunder. Just about every island has something for you to do, although it‚Äôs usually only that one thing. What I mean by this is that if you go to an island that has an objective for killing a bunch of pirates, that‚Äôs the only objective you‚Äôll have on the entire island. So although they‚Äôre all different objectives, there‚Äôs still only one per island. Regardless of how many objectives each island has, they all feel rewarding and incentivize you to take part in whatever that islands task might be. For an island holding a hunting challenge, I‚Äôd find a tall cabin decked out with some armor and weapons, all ready to be swiped once I killed the required amount of deer. I like that you actually have a reason to do these objectives, as all too often games put the objectives there for you to do, but don‚Äôt actually give you any real reason to do them. Something else I think that Salt does well is give a feeling of genuine realism without actually having too many realistic mechanics. I think the premise of the game itself, coupled with the extremely minimalistic way the game is made, makes for a weird experience where you don‚Äôt have too many particularly realistic mechanics, yet all the same you feel as if you‚Äôre actually there. It‚Äôs a difficult feeling to describe, but it‚Äôs what makes Salt able to pull you in with gameplay that‚Äôs really rather simple. Your time on these high seas is going to be spent either crafting, killing, or sailing, and that‚Äôs surprisingly enough to keep you occupied. However I haven‚Äôt gotten too far into Salt and I certainly haven‚Äôt even touched the main storyline, but as it stands now I feel that there‚Äôs enough content here to almost, in places, make the game feel like simulator rather than an arcade-y survival game.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Swashbuckling fun! Roaming the high seas and plundering a variety of islands is a blast, and Salt does a perfect job of making you feel immersed in the role of both an explorer and a pirate; the only problem is the all too average combat and horrendous player models.

[h1]If you found this review helpful or entertaining then feel free to leave a comment and join my Steam Curator Group at  [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9577715-Mudkips-Gaming/]Mudkips Gaming![/url]

review: I've had this game since 2014/15 I believe, it's come a long way since then. It's a pretty nice game if you just want to kick back and relax. The devs have only 3 people and they're pretty active in the community which is nice. I'd recommend getting it when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052380704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 14006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13151, 'last_played': 1594698162}
review:
This is one of my favorite games of all time. All the negatives people are citing are true. The combat is super basic, the graphics are unique if simple and at times even ugly. You can and do get lost. Those things are true. Also true is that Salt is a work of ambition, beauty, genius and depth that few titles attempt.  It is a relaxing, open rogue-like first person sailing game. It is totally unique on every level. No part of this game (except the item menu) works exactly like any part of any other game. Even though that is true, it feels impressively intuitive. You may want to watch a short video about how to use a compass, (if you don't already know) but apart from that, the adventure will unfold for you the way good modern games should, no FAQs or tutorials neccessary. Once you've set sail the horizons gently tug you out into the open blue. 

My only real suggestions for improvements involve increased budget like adding content complexity (like insides for the huts in pirate villages) and things like that. I feel also that there could be a bit more to most of the NPC camps. I would change nothing about the general art direction but would appreciate a complete divorce from anime (the eyes look referential and that isn't appropriate) . I also feel that the texture art is misplaced alot of the time. But again, I'm sort of just complaing about budget there - which is unfair. 

All around one of the best ever. Amazing. 

If you're looking for violence, adrenaline or hard-core survival, give it a pass and save us the misplaced negative review. 
That being said this game DOES require you to be violent (simple simple click fighting and moderately challenging skill based archery) just in case I've mislead you into thinking its a walksim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059881955', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1546475971}

author: {'steamid': '76561198158618292', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1519003888}
review:
[h1]Salt[/h1]
You wake up on an island without knowing what happens, you walk by them until you meet a person in a campfire that has a corpse beside you, why not talk to him? Thanks to talking to the stranger, you repair a balza and go in search of a true adventure. Will you become the captain of a great ship with a huge reputation and that your enemies tremble with just hearing your name or will you just be another captain of a shabby ship that nobody respects? You choose.


[u][b]Positive Points[/b][/u]
‚Ä¢A large number of options to modify the game to your liking or your power, as well as in graphic aspects, sound or controls, among others.
‚Ä¢It has the possibility to choose between two game modes (normal and hardcore, one life) and how your world is going to be generated (a random seed, a personalized one and the predefined one).
‚Ä¢The control of the boats is simple and easy to master (the one of the first boat that we obtain is very original inclusively) so in a few hours you can become an expert sailor.
‚Ä¢Automatic saves every very short period of time, which greatly helps if we have a problem (such as a power outage).
‚Ä¢On more than one occasion, you will laugh out loud when completing the achievements and watch them leave.
‚Ä¢We can have different effects, positive and negative, by consuming some objects.
‚Ä¢A large number of objects that we will have to discover in the great open world that it has.
‚Ä¢During certain times of the day we will meet with low tide or high tide, it has happened to me a couple of times to leave my boat near the shore and to wake up having to push it to be able to unclog it.
‚Ä¢A very funny touch of the title is that when he dies he gives us an option that says: Rage Quit. Test it yourselves.
‚Ä¢The game does not have high requirements to play it, with a decent computer you can run it without problems.
‚Ä¢There are stories of pirates about their lives or their adventures, we can find them by killing some of them or looting their treasure chests.
‚Ä¢You can customize your boats the way you want and as much as you want, the only inconvenient is the space that you can get to occupy with them but nothing else.
‚Ä¢I have not found almost any bug that affects the gameplay itself, only some very small (Like the one that puts a pause on the boat that we started, when you return to the game it is as if submerged under the water and we hit a big jump towards above)
‚Ä¢At any time we can select our boat and put it in any position on the water (Yes, I found out about this after spending hours pushing the boat that had been stuck).
‚Ä¢Many will say: '' The game has bad graphics '' and this is false, because their graphics are based on the simplicity they have and what makes it so characteristic.
‚Ä¢Its developers listen to the feedback and update it every very little time.
‚Ä¢The price you have is very fair to what they are giving you so I do not think it means a problem when paying attention to the game.
‚Ä¢It is compatible with steam control and best of all is that it has a trial version which you can download to see what you are buying.
‚Ä¢We can get food in several different ways, from hunting wild animals to fishing.
‚Ä¢It has a normal learning curve so it will take you some time to understand things but it is like a chain reaction, once you understand you begin to understand everything that is related to it.

[u][b]Neutral Points[/b][/u]
‚Ä¢The controls are too simple, which for some may be beneficial, but for people who are looking for a big challenge, they will not get it in any way.
‚Ä¢It does not contain any type of tutorial on which we can base ourselves to understand the game, but there is a kind of "book" where it explains some basic things.
‚Ä¢The initial inventory, which we will find on the first island that appears, is always the same regardless of the seed we use (The amount of wood and rocks that we will find in the land may vary) but this has two points of view; The good, where thanks to it balances the beginning of all the players so that nobody finds a seed that is easier to others; and the bad one, where once you have played many times it becomes very repetitive and you want to have other objects, even if they are worse.
‚Ä¢When you kill all the pirates present on an island you will be marked in a treasure chest where you can find various valuables, the bad thing about this is that you have to kill if or if all the enemies, which It seems unrealistic because just having a ganzua or dragging it to your boat would be enough.
‚Ä¢The sound is something common but the music is very good, the problem is that the sounds predominate in quantity over the music so we can only enjoy certain moments.
‚Ä¢I have seen almost no visual effect except for that of the sun and that of some particular enemies, but that of the sun reflected in the water is magnificent.
‚Ä¢Its difficulty varies according to what we are talking about, for example: Obtaining objects, at the beginning, is very easy. The combat is extremely difficult.
‚Ä¢The collection and obtaining of resources is very different from what we have seen in other titles, for example, to obtain wood we will have to pick it up from the ground and we will not be able to cut it. The most normal thing is to have to break the stones to obtain their internal resources (stone, minerals) but this is also wrong due to one reason, the existence of the peak, this object does not make any difference to the rest of ways to break a stone.

[u][b]Negative Points[/b][/u]
‚Ä¢To begin with, the game only has one language despite the large user base it owns, so developers should focus more on that.
‚Ä¢HUD too simple, only white letters in a background, although I personally like the font they used.
‚Ä¢The way we discover the map or the way we can know where we have been is too complicated, it is based on a system that they wanted to make realistic but it is only annoying and that many people can not understand for many reasons, a totally unnecessary implementation of the game.
‚Ä¢The pirates attacked you without any apparent reason, this may be due to the fame they have had, but it would not be a bad idea to be able to talk to them and avoid in any way that they attack you (either bribing them or just talking). The opposite happens with the people with whom you can trade, why not be able to attack them or rob them?.
‚Ä¢The combat is horrible sincerely. All weapons are equal, only some of them perform more damage or others have less speed when hitting, and the fighting options we have with them are also. I summarize the fight: Paste, block waiting for the opponent to hit, hit, block again, hit, lock again ...
‚Ä¢The NPC run much faster than you so if in a combat you do not have stamina you have to give up for dead.
‚Ä¢Missions, both main and secondary, are typical and boring for the most part.
‚Ä¢The boats only have 2 states: Braked and in speed without variety.
‚Ä¢The design of the characters, both ourselves and the NPC, are very repetitive and very simple (Even when we put on our character's outfit is modified as seen), there are only some specific ones that look different.

[u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u]
I may not have put all the points I wanted in this analysis but with what I have I realize that it is a very good game that has great potential and is on its way to the star, but it falters in many points and its developers need be immediately aware of them. I recommend buying the game if you have the money. And most of all I recommend playing this game with friends because this title is made to be played with other people, if you try to go solo you will get bored after a few hours.


[h1]FINAL SCORE: 7[/h1]


[quote] This review was sent to [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/gaming_until_end]Gaming Until End[/url], through the generous contribution of [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/HellCowON]HellCow.[/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198211672644', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1550719399}
review:
With about 50 hours on this game (40 of them offline) I should review it. I got this game a long time ago and I got to say, I have been repeatedly dissapointed with the updates.

The combat is just this, hit mouse 1 to swing. Thats it. All the weapons do the same thing, and the bow moves at snail speed when strung. Its almost impossible to hit a deer while it is running. This is dissapointing cause of how many updates they have had since this game was made.

The UI doesnt help either, you push a button and i opens crafting. You can't really open your inventory from a keypad. E is the locked button to pick stuff up, and where it is on the keyboard it breaks the immersion. Thrying to look and grab something while traveling is annoying. I have to go into the crafting menue, then click on the inventory. In the middle of combat, to switch to a "different" weapon, you have to go through two menues and then clunkily move your sword to your character. 

Now lets talk about the quests. In the 50hours I played I never got to the main questline. That is because I could never find it. This is because it is completely random where you find the tavern to get the quest, and it is almost garenteed you will not find it for at least the first 6hours of playing the game. 

The ONLY saving grace is the exploration of this game, it is so much fun. Building your first ship and traveling around the different islands, you can completely randomize the islands so each one of them is fun. It is cool to happen by a island with three or four pirate camps on it. This is the enjoyable part of the game and what I liked the most. 

I would give this game a 5/10, at least the newer updates. The game is fun but if you don't like exploration do NOT buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967125826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1620497602}
review:
A great game about island exploration and slow-paced sea adventure which makes it really unique. Multiplayer makes it also a nice place to chill on a boat with some friends.

Playing it since the first days of early access and I'm very happy that the devs stayed on target with their own concept.

If you want thrilling sea battles there are and will be other good games. But if you like standing at the ship's rail, watching the sunset while listening to the sound of the sea you are at the right place right here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174166697', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1517040367}
review: Bad game, all you do you do is TRY to sail and get lost. Don't even get me started on the fighting. Games not good don't buy in my opinion. Rust is 5000% better. GG salt

author: {'steamid': '76561198020053064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2550, 'last_played': 1611646598}
review:
As of a few days back, Salt has been fully released. I love this game for it's exploration, sights, and simplicity.

HOWEVER in it's current state, there are many many many MANY glaring problems with the game. One of which is the only use for cannons is to shoot from sea onto land, specifically killing ancient statues. Nothing else and for no other reason do you need cannons whatsoever.

The game emphasizes getting off the boat and checking islands which all look similar to each other spare a few, and combat which is not very complex and gets old fast. Also, I can't seem to hit those parrys every time, even with perfect timing.

I have a lot of gripes about this game, and saying it's a completed project at 20 bucks irritates me.

BUT If you can pick it up for 5 bucks or so, this is a good purchase for some laid back exploration.

As of today, I cannot in good conscience recommend this game to anyone. It's fun for me, but I know it's got less content than pretty much every other survival game out there to date.



Add some sea battles and I'll revisit this review.
Until then, this is Minecraft without the Mining, since this is Sea faring without Sea Combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037359548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8573, 'last_played': 1577563045}
review:
This game is quite casual once you have a good set of weaponry and i have pretty much obtained most gear as well as defeated Draegan in less than a month. It haslots of potential but i would like to have a bit more ship furniture, quests, island types and most importantly Random generated pirate npc ships that attack. Also having the bounty hunters spawn on your ship at random when you have a bounty on you could be nice. 
The ability to have different gear color sets to allow quick swapout of armor and weapons was a very useful nice touch. Equipment assigned to these sets should show some indicator that they are in use. A sell all marked as trash option will also be quite nice.
Love the game and hope you follow some of my ideas.
Thanks for the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198129209655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1532107237}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055347174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1519718831}
review: I really enjoy this game. The things it does well are enough for the purchase. There are a couple of things it harken back to an earlier time in gaming, such as the combat, but these are very forgivable if you think of this as a real time strategy role playing game. I feel like I have only scrated the surface of this game but have found it compelling, fun and addictive. I was planning on playing an hour in my first sitting and ended up playing for six instead! No in game purchases or loot crates in this game and after coming off of some games that do that this is a breath of fresh air. If you like exploration, crafting, navigation and cartography (map making) you really can't go wrong with the very reasonable purchase price on Salt. 8/10 for me (so far).

author: {'steamid': '76561197981998466', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4144, 'last_played': 1518374325}
review:
Salt is a great game - just understand what you're getting before you purchase it. If you're looking for a Sea of Thieves alternative or a pirate RPG, prepare to be underwhelmed. If you're looking for a quiet game about exploring, you've struck gold. 

Salt's best feature is it's naval exploration. The boats are lots of fun to learn how to steer properly, and I absolutely love the idea that you need to navigate and make your own map using just a compass and sextant. 

The island's aren't too varied and often only have 2-3 interesting things on them, but you often won't have to sail far to find another one. The quests are a bit simplistic (find this item and bring it back is the most common) but there is some depth to certain questlines, like the Innkeeper's. 

Don't expect much from the combat. Learning to block properly is what will give you an edge. Other than that, it's just hitting  your opponent. But as I said above, this is a game about exploring. Combat is simply one aspect of exploration.

I would encourage the development team to consider adding ship-to-ship combat, and pirate ships that roam the seas, as a potential DLC in the future. 

This game is great to play with a friend after a long day at work, if you need something to keep your attention but not overwhelm you. 

Considering this was built entirely by 3 people, I would say great job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066772237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2462, 'last_played': 1542692415}
review:
I have played a few other survival games, and here was how my thought process went:

Ok, crafting menu, there it is. Hey look, a book of crating, boat...boat...boat... raft, close enough. That is a lot of wood. Time to get swinging *hits tree for a few minutes* I can't harvest trees... hmm, *wanders around island* ah good there is wood on the ground, how much do I need again... oh, this is gonna take a lot of farming...

Luckily, things panned out for the better as there are broken ships that you can find at various islands (a broken raft at the first island) that take less materials to fix than the base crafting recipe, which I like. Different aspects of the game took some getting used to and getting a sextant is SO much more important than a compas as you have to make your own map, which I enjoy doing.

I feel like a privateer in this game, doing what I want, killing pirates and cultists, helping those that will pay me, and hunting down not only animals on the various islands but the sweet sweet loot that comes from everywhere. I am currently hooked on this game and can't wait to jump back in. 

What I like:
The ships
The sailing
The treasure/loot/booty
The derelect ships
The hunting
The combat (some don't like it, I've gotten used to it)
Make your own map

What I'd like to see improved:
More map markers
Ability to blend islands that are L shaped on map
Improved help tools (hover over stats to know how they benifit/hinder you)
Flag guide (something to tell you what npc flags mean, the fishing guild flag is confusing as to what it is)
Laddered buildings being safe from enemy attacks (but allowing humanoid enemies and bosses to get into them to attack you)

All in all, I am enjoying many aspects of this game and will continue playing it as it is just so fun for me right now. Off to be a privateer! Yarr!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130794935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1518367674}
review:
I really liked the concept, graphics, pace, etc... (I know I only have few hours of gameplay, and it has many other things to offer)

but sorry. what kind of pirate game has no ships other than yours (neither friendly nor hostile)? no sea threats of any kind? no guns of any kind?

combat is minecraft-ish, ships and cannons are basically vanity collectables, islands are basically mini-games (there is "find the treasure", "kill all pirates remaining to get the reward chest", "collect the resources scattered around", "merchant point", "boss island", etc..and very little beyond that}

in a nutshell, it's not a survival sand-box game... and "pirate" is just a shallow thematic for the artstyle.

Sorry... I was really excited about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030787662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2954, 'last_played': 1518748459}
review:
I've spent around 40 hours total playing Salt, starting back in 2015 when it was in Early Access. I fired it back up recently after the full release and have been pleasantly surprised at the additions to the game since I last played. Ship models especially are much much better than the early versions.

Overall, Salt is a fun little open-world sandbox game with lots of exploration, a bit of quest structure if you want it, a variety of weapons and armor in ascending tiers of rarity/power, and some interesting mechanics that evoke the feeling of exploring an unknown world and charting your own course on your adventures. It's a simple, pleasant, relaxing experience. 

It's *not* a detailed pirate simulator, a graphical powerhouse, or action-packed combat game. Melee fighting is fairly straightforward - you attack with quick or heavy strikes, you block or dodge, and that's that. Likewise, sailing is fun, direct, and lightweight - you point your ship in a direction, hoist your sails, and go. There's no wind direction, sail plans, leeway, doldrums, or other more complex elements to conducing a ship from point A to point B. It manages to be a charming experience in spite or perhaps because of these straightforward mechanics. 

There are some disappointments, of course - the absence of any kind of NPC activity on or in the ocean is probably the biggest letdown. (The world is populated with various NPCs with a variety of functions, but they're all landbound.) The performance isn't great and it doesn't feel optimized as well as it could be. The lighting can look surprisingly good for an indie game, but the contrast is often frustratingly stark - shadowed forest areas can be very dark even on a sunny day. 

But these issues and the relatively small scope of the game haven't stopped me from getting immersed for several hours at a time -- fighting pirate captains, completing rare gear sets, building new sailing ships, crafting new items, investigating weird cults, digging up ancient relics, and just sailing around the world to find new islands. 

If you go into this remembering what it is - a small-scale indie game created by three people in one of their first forays into game development - and you enjoy the basic premise of an exploring game, you'll probably enjoy Salt. I'd recommend picking i up on a sale as it's a bit light to merit the $20, but maybe that will change if Lavaboots continues to add content post-release.

(Also, just ignore the reviews claiming they've 'abandoned' the game or 'cashed out' or the the game is some sort of EA scam or whatever. Anyone who's been following Salt's development is aware that Lavaboots has pretty much done everything you want an indie dev to do with an Early Access game. They've been active, transparent, responsive, and honest about the game's progress at each step of the way. And - lo and behold - they *released a working game* at the end of the process. That's more than a lot of much bigger EA / Kickstarter projects can say.)

review:

Pros:
Sky.
Sailing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987041850', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1512142949}
review:
"Release" of Salt is simple message by devs: i give up!. 
Current progress of game is nowhere around release phase, it is still Early Access with years of time before it is finished. 
I could understand if they added modding support so users themself could expand world but in this crude condition of game, devs have done the worst possible choice and choosen to sully their name and studio with negative reviews just to get some money and run away.
developer_response:
Hey! 

I just wanted to let you know we are still supporting the game and are by no means trying to abandon the project. We're a small team of only three guys and have spent the past four years working on Salt. We tried hard to be transparent throughout the development process and deliver on the content we promised.

If you come across any bugs or things that you feel like is keeping you from having a good experience, please let us know! You can send any bugs to bugreport@saltthegame.com or report them on the forums. We are still going to be trying to change what we can going forward. 

Thanks for taking the time to write this up and giving us your feedback!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051261898', 'num_games_owned': 872, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 6673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4862, 'last_played': 1519009233}
review:
So I love this game a lot.  It's the kind of game where I can spend hours playing without even noticing. That being said, a lot of the things negative reviews say are valid critisisms about the game. Combat is not super interesting, it can get pretty laggy, and there's a lot of sailing. Like, original Wind Waker levels of sailing. But in spite of those things, and, in some cases, because of the things other people don't like (What's wrong with the art style? It's not going in the MOMA, it can be cartoony), I think this game is great.

BUT. If you're on the fence about buying this game, I highly recommend downloading the demo. Sure, there are a lot of things that make Salt cool that you can't experience in the demo, but if you don't like the demo, you're definitely not going to like the rest of the game. And if you do like what you see in the demo, you can port all your progress over to the full version of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181720990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1452639856}
review: Developing a game takes a concept. Doom was a hot wreck but a new concept and fun. This is a new concept and fun. Doom being made with many more devs than 3. I bought this game happily for fun here and there like doom. A great developer starter game that shows promise for 3 new developers. A showcase game of these 3 depelopers concepts and what is given to us in time historily as they can easily remaster and build a developer group. I Never Once After Seeing The Graphic Or People Detail thought these developers were going higher than the visual given.  A pure fun ride. A time killer and a "hey watch a fool play a game or play this and watch us master a game. Watch us grow. BTW thank you for keep us going" . This was never an end game yet these 3 developers love to make/create/share and for three people to retire on a meer meh i would say 70 grand isnt happening from a 4 year build. In time you support your build and move to something other developers and or sponsers will follow. Or bleed to death. I will not state these Devs have given up on this game. It is clearly stated many times if there are glitches here and there they will try to help. With 3 Developers at some point in time you have to bring forth the next concept and hope for a sponser or you bleed dry is what I am saying. It is here to remaster with a larger group in the future like i hope they follow up on and deserve. Great job and thank you for the here and there time killer. Well worth it! Most of all I hope you 3 come back with another awesome concept for me to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007827496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1518057853}
review:
I cannot recommend this game it's 19.99 pricetag. Half-price, maybe. 

I really like what they do because it is done well. I don't mind the simplified graphics but only if the game has depth. That is where it gets a little foggy for me.

As a pirate looking for 'adventure' I was more interested in pirating and there doesn't seem to be any of that in the game. So... this is more of an exploration game with pirate clothes. Sure you can find treasure, nav a boat/ship but you there isn't a crew to have, ships to plunder, nor towns or villages to pillage. 

Like I said, what they do is good, but it's what they don't do for pirating that marks this game as not recommended.  There could be so much more in a game like this, but there it's not there. 

Maybe worth it for 10USD or less not 20USD.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996415952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1935, 'last_played': 1640901471}
review:
Nope, this game is far from being "done". Devs rushed out of EA to start making a new game. This game has a lot of potential, but it feels like an alpha version. I was hoping for an update, where AI ships actually sail across the ocean, which can be attacked, but NO, it doesn't exist. The ocean just feels dead. What's even the point of cannons? (Besides shooting the ship of your friend in multiplayer)... Ships can't even sink! Don't get fooled by the video, it looks like there are pirates running on a ship and a few seconds later cannons are shot at another ship (and vice versa). Both will never actually happen (except if you senselessly shoot at each other, but even if you get hit, there is no damage to ships, can cannons actually kill you? If yes, then it's even dumber, because you respawn and can instantly teleport to your "friend/foe/othership whatever"... I just dont get it...)
I'm actually pretty disappointed and feel fooled. The concent is just missing. I'll keep an eye open at Sea of Thieves, hopefully that one will be better...

author: {'steamid': '76561198023384477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5062, 'last_played': 1517033214}
review:
What a waste of potential. I was under the (potentially incorrect) impression that this game would continue to be developed. Seeing that it's released now tells me that they either gave up or decided it was time to cash out. Regardless, as pointed out by others, the combat is lackluster at best, and the interface is not very well designed, to put it kindly.

The sailing, fishing, and a handful of other minor features are nice, but remain underdeveloped. There was immense potential here, from ship combat to battling monsters at sea, a dueling system to reputation with pirate sects. None of that will come about, apparently.

All this is as of full release is a sailing simulator, and while that's somewhat decent (compass, sextant, other tools help make sailing feel involved, not to mention that you have to be your own cartographer), there isn't enough there to justify the price.

What a saddening waste of so much potential.
developer_response:
Hello! 

First, thank you for your feedback and taking the time to write out what you liked and didn't like about the game. I did want to let you know that we will be continuing support of the game even after the full release with bug fixes, balances, and other changes. Feedback like this is important in helping us understand what we did right and what we did wrong. 

I also wanted to assure you that we didn't release in order just to cash out or anything like that. We are a really small team (only 3 members) and we've been working on Salt for around 4 years. And while we loved the idea of content like ship combat, monsters in the sea, etc., we knew that would be a massive undertaking and we just didn't have the team size or resources to do it. I wish we did as I agree that type of content would be great! Instead we focused our efforts on quests, loot, exploration and discovery, and multiplayer and tried to add as much content in that regard as possible. 

We will be continuing to improve as much as we can and taking feedback like this into account in the future. 

Thanks again for taking the time to let us know your thoughts!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198092096120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1517722848}
review: I tried it, it's a decent game to some extent. And it's early access too, but the direction it's headed just really gets me having a hard time getting excited about it. Nothing wrong on the games part, however I will say I don't beleive for the slightest of seconds that this game is worth 15 bucks, they even announced it'd increase to 20 but why? Im taking a good look at the game and its price, thinking "you get what you paid for", well this game has some really optimistic people behind it if they evaluate that something that looks like it was made originally as a mod for roblox, with the open world aspect that essentially is the equivalent of a sandbox with only 4 toys to play with [figure of speech], is worth 20 bucks. Again, the game isn't bad, but I fail to see future enjoyment playing it. I envy those who do, my friends included who will continue to play without me while I go play tf2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042594619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1518308983}
review:
Although simple, Salt is a pretty enjoyable game. I would highly recommend playing with a friend with the new multiplayer update - travelling together on an infinite sea is really fun.

I would have loved to been able to customise a character, as well as viewing more of the equipment I was wearing. The combat felt a bit flaky at times, and after a while the exploration got a little samey. However, I look forward to coming back to this one and seeing what's new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026614187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2829, 'last_played': 1702960316}
review:
OMG. I love the main theme, i love how i can have my very own pirate ship... I love this game. I haven't played long enough in one game to have everything, but i really just love this game. When i figure out how to correctly use the compas and not get myself lost, and become amazing at cartography (actually kinda easy), that's when i feel the best. Killing all those pirates on the island and stealing their big ships is fun. Haven't played the multiplayer yet, though.

And it's been a while since i last played, so I don't know if they fixed this yet, but one bug I loved was getting launched into the air when I'm sailing on my tiny ship and it goes through a bigger ship. That was really entertaining to me. xD

Good job so far, guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141573968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4517, 'last_played': 1559056833}
review:
First, this game IS early access, be prepared. It is not polished, player characters are all the same and not customizable except with outfits, it is not in any way bug free, it is not perfect. If you want those things, stop looking at Early Access. 

Have been playing multi-player and having a great deal of fun. Be prepared to really search for things. Working in a team with voice coms, we have been able to complete quests, call out resource finds for those who need them, and find new islands to explore. 

I have played single player a little, not nearly as fun but I was able to get some extra resources built up that way. I much prefer multi player on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085644250', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1517098196}
review:
If you're looking for pretty good a Single-Player/COOP Sea of Thieves alternative, this game is pretty much that, but with its own twist and mechanics, if you like sailing on a infinite sea and exploring an infinite amount of small, medium, big and even huge islands with tons of loot to collect then this game will deliver just that

note: this game is an exploration game, it is not an action game, so if you're like me and LOVE to just explore endlessly and aquire loot then this game is for you

author: {'steamid': '76561198061347421', 'num_games_owned': 1551, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1516748184}
review:
So let's get down to the nitty gritty:

What is Salt?

Salt is a Nautical themed exploration game that's main charm lies in sailing the open sea, exploring items, and getting loot.

Pros:
Good Sailing
Amazing Exploration
???

Cons:
Terrible Combat
Poorly Optimized
Terrible graphics and models
Buggy
Terribly UI


I want to like Salt, I really do, but the combat is absolutely terrible, and the interface is atrocious.

My Suggestions:
FIX COMBAT
Clean up and simplify the UI
Update the models, as the Player models and pirates look like something a middle school game designer would draw up.

Salt may be a game to watch out for in a year or two's time, but at the moment it's not worth your money.
developer_response:
Hey! 

Thank you for leaving a review and letting us know what your experience was like Salt. I'm sorry that overall you felt it was a negative experience but I did want to ask that if you find any bugs please email us at bugreport@saltthegame.com and we will fix them asap. We are continuing support of Salt even after full release fixing bugs and other changes. 

Thanks again for your time and feedback!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050946030', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1581291155}
review:
Salt is an amazing and immersive online experience that makes you feel as if you're swashbuckling pirates on the coast of an alien island. The lack of backstory for your character gives you so much space to improvise and be creative with your own legend. The massive open world game gives the player so many opportunities to explore for themselves and find all sorts of lore-based items. The boats, although glitchy at times, are an amazing segue from island to island. Personally, one of my favorite things to do is to while on a boat waiting for the next island to appear is to fish or to read one of the many, many books found around the game. The combat system, although very rudimentary, can be quite stimulating and the player can't help but feel rewarded with the game's looting system. Many of the items, while seemingly useless, have many secret parts to them that allow users to access opportunities along the way that wouldn't normally be an open door. The game works fantastically, and the content of the game gives off a vibe that makes the player feel accomplished. I seriously recommend the purchase of this game.

Edit: I also recommend that the player experiences everything on their own, meaning:          

DON'T LOOK THE GAME UP!

It's way more fun to experience everything on your own!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008470623', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1515995571}
review:
OUTDATED REVIEW:(I haven't played the new update, will update this review when game is fully out, don't get your panties in a bunch)I do like this game, a friend and I played it till we had pretty much done all we could. 
Problems are quiet are few and here are some :

1: Is that even with marking islands on the map it takes ages to do the quests.
2: Ships don't have cannons
3: No AI ships Q.Q Please put this in the game
4: Most loot is all the same from pirate islands
5: No sense of scaling - Some bosses and enemies go from very op to very weak. Often within an hours of game play. 
6: Even tho Multiplayer is available, its not as enjoyable as what I thought it would be.
7: You get to create huge ships however you can't share it with friends/allies (This includes chests)
8: No point teaming with someone as all the stuff can't be shared in the first place

All this is subject to change however THIS is still a fun little game to play with a friend or two. 
The art style is cute, reminds me of unturned. 
Gameplay is smooth however saving bugs the game
It is a huge game, just takes forever.

Try the demo, if its not for you then thats cool. I will keep playing this game all the way till it comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019908029', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1518159506}
review:
UPDATE SINCE RELEASE:
Don't buy it. They barely did anything with it. I'm assuming since Sea of Thieves released which is a better (and way more expensive) game they just gave up. It's glitchy and all the items are the same. After a while you realize there's no real end game it's just junk hording. Kind of saddened to be honest because I spent so many hours on here with my girlfriend. She and I loved this, but as like everyone else we soon found out it needed so much more and the developers were giving so much less. 


Needs a whole lot more, but it's fun.

Worth the price right now? Probably not, but in the future I expect it will be better. I recommend it for people who love to play passive gameplay with not very challenging combat. It's fun with friends as well. Just needs a whole lot more bug fixes & content added like character customization would be greatr or even building structures on islands where you can store your things and decorate as well. The map is a little difficult to learn. Otherwise it's a great game. Spent a few hours. Have high expectations for this I won't lie.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997510749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1515020082}
review:
no se por donde empezar, de antemano no lo recomiendo, tengo mucha experiencia en juegos de crafting y de supervivencia y les puedo decir que no es ni uno ni otro, a groso modo la situaci√≥n es as√≠.
eres un personaje muy feo en mi punto de vista muy mal animado y tosco, el cual estas en una isla muy peque√±a (demasiado peque√±a) que vas encontrando recuersos tirados ya que solo las piedras las puedes romper y conseguir asi algunos materiales, los arboles ironicamente no los puedes talar (al menos si se puede nuinca supe como) la madera lietarlmente la vas encontrando tirada y eso te obliga a migrar a otra isla y asi buscar como imbecil recursos tirados, carece completamente de tutorial y no hay mucha informaci√≥n en la web sobre este titulo, el conseguir alimento es sencillo lo raro es que lo encuentras tirado o en confres que encuentras en las islas muy genericos por cierto y de unos venados (que es toda la fauna que he encontrado, bueno un "perico" enorme casi imposible de cazar), que por cierto es muy dificil matarlos pero no imposible, el crafteo es muy limitado, abres el menu genral despues seleccionas una mesa de trabajo (no es tan intuitiva como creen) y ahi vas seleccionando un material y te dice que es lo puedes hacer con √©l, pero segun hay recetas en el juego que la verdad yo no he encontrado ninguna, me encontre un barco que se tenioa que reparar para poderlo "usar" y los materiales que solicitaban era algo exagerado. en resumen, creo que le hace falta mas recetas, mas flora y fauna, mejores formas de conseguir materiales y variedad, cuando te encuentras con piratas el combate es muy rustico y simple, creo que lo unico que me gusto del juego son los sonidos ambientales y los graficos del agua e iluminaci√≥n fuera de eso lo siento como un juego de supernintendo 100% infantil.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997753216', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1514617265}
review:
I played for about an hour which consisted mainly of: 
-finding logs on the ground in stead of chopping down the hundreds of bloody trees around me? Why?
-shooting all of my 9 arrows at 1 deer and still not killing it cus the hit boxes suck but deer are apparently also god beasts who can take a head shot and still prance around like nothing happened? What?
-let's not forget that 90% of the time I played was actually spent just slowly travelling on a fucking raft....

This game has potential but as it stands it's a boring sailing simulator. I feel like I'm playing windwaker all over again.
I understand this game is more about the journey than the destination (or building, ect.) But when the journey is at least over 5 mins of me boringly dragging the steering a little to then left then a little to the right while I watch an island barley grow in the distance, it's just not fun.

As it stands I just can't recommend this game. Even as a relaxing leisure game. I was filling my time with other things while sailing and it was still just super boring. I will check back with this game in the future and maybe repurchase it then but I CANNOT recommend this game until they fix the boring long sailing - nothing happening sequences.

P.S. since so haven't played this game long some might say I didn't give it enough chance and maybe once you get a bigger ship or get to another area sailing won't be a ls dull but the fact remains that for now, at least I'm the beginning, the sailing is so long and boring that it sucks all the will to continue. Oh and I bought this FOR a fun little sailing game so ya this shouldn't be an issue. Please fix this and make it not as long or somehow more interesting when sailing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991237618', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 4510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1517120853}
review:
The Negative reviews fall into a few categories: 
 
1) Didn't like the graphics (the game looks like the screenshots - what did you expect?)
2) Combat is lame (once again ... look at the video .. you hit them .. they hit you)
3) People who thought this game was something it is not. (This game is NOT a survival game.  It is not RUST in Pirate land.)

Salt is an exploration game and a RPG game.  It is quest driven.  The map is random and infinite but completing quests is the only real way to progress in the game.  

People who get turned off early by this game are not experiencing even a tiny drop of what this game is.  

The combat is not intense because this is not a action game - it is adventure.  Collecting ingreidents, collecting items, going to new islands, mapping the islands (you make the map yourself and get rewards for correctly mapping it).  This game feels like Zelda the wind waker and even looks like it a little bit ( no dungeons though - so far)

This game is about discovery and loot and quests and mystery and sailing.  

Also ... getting good at shooting birds out of the air ... it is difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993608048', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3228, 'last_played': 1613017456}

I was a fan of this game before but with the addition of multiplayer it really has become a must have for any pirate fan. It really is amazing fighting pirates together and looking for treasure on the high seas as you defeat the pirate kings and stuff. 

My hours don't lie, it's well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040859430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2445, 'last_played': 1525921990}
review:
This game has been an absolute BLAST to play. Though simple in idea there is lots to do. I love games where you can explore and go on adventures and quests. The ships are fun to operate and decorate. You dont waste alot of time chopping down trees and such you come across the items randomly lying around to collect. The fighting of pirates and mobs is exciting and simple. 



I hope they continue to expand this game with more items to craft and decorate your ships, It would be nice if they made it possible to create your own dwelling as well.
