author: {'steamid': '76561198109596551', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 7014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1512168271}
review:
Que dire de Salt...? Salt nous plonge dans une ambiance calme avec une exploration ouverte sur une √©tendue oc√©anique couvertes d' √Æles ou il vous faudra survivre et vous √©quiper afin de vous pr√©parer au mieux pour les combats. Les morceaux de musique sont bien choisis et relaxent le joueur. La libert√© d'explorer l'univers de salt est vaste et nous pouvons commencer par n'importe quelle √Æle , il n'y a pas de mission pr√©d√©finie , ici on peut naviguer ou l'on souhaite et la libert√© de mouvement est des plus excitantes. Les loots sont plut√¥t diversifi√©s et int√©ressants m√™me si nous sommes qu'en alpha et qu'ils vont certainement prendre une autre dimension lors des prochaines mises √† jour. Pour l'instant , salt me procure une exp√©rience de jeu unique ou l'on a envie de prendre son b√¢teau pour tomber sur un tr√©sor ind√©nichable. Le gros b√©mol selon moi du jeu r√©side dans sa facilit√© de se nourrir car celle-ci est tr√®s abonbante et peu rare pour un jeu de survie , ce qui rend salt assez simple dans son ensemble , il serait judicieux de rajouter de la difficult√© sur de nombreux domaines de jeu. La p√™che est assez int√©ressante globalement , quant √† la chasse , il serait b√©n√©fique de rajouter d'autres gibiers plus rares et davantage de fourrure. Conclusion : Salt est incomparable aux autres jeu de survie ,     ayant ador√© don't starve ! Salt est tout aussi excitant avec un d√©cor r√©aliste , il est graphiquement plaisant pour les yeux et salt incarne une libert√© de naviguation plut√¥t jouissive , non vraiment salt a de l'avenir devant lui , il vaut largement ses 15 euros , essayez-le : vous ne serez pas d√©√ßu !

Parenth√®se (je viens de p√™cher un dragonfish , un poisson tr√®s rare puisque c'est un loot bleu). Voil√† pour que le jeu soit √©pique , il faut nous donner la possibilit√© de p√™cher des poissons √©piques ou des tr√©sors sous l'eau , je suis s√ªr que le joueur aimerait davantage de surprise au niveau de la p√™che ou du craft , il faudrait aussi parvenir √† rajouter du contenu craft , d'autres livres √† looter ou nous aurions acc√®s √† de nouveaux crafts , je pense qu'il manque certains animaux comme des oiseaux (plumes) , des ours - mode agressif - (fourrure) , des singes (queues) , des renards (fourrure) , des serpents -mode agressif - (langues) ou encore des toucans (becs) nich√©s dans les arbres , voir des tortues de mer sur le sable (carapaces). D'autres arbres peuvent √™tes implant√©s pour r√©cup√©rer du bois extr√™mement rare avec une h√¢che. ce serait pas mal aussi de rajouter des bananiers ou des fruits exotiques , des noix de coco par exemple. On pourrait tout aussi bien rajouter sur certaines √Æles des coquillages sur le sable (collecte qu√™te). 

Quoi d'autres? certaines √Æles devraient avoir plut√¥t un type essentiellement montagnard avec pourquoi pas des acc√®s √† des grottes souterraines (eau souterraine) avec une surprise au bout. Une autre id√©e aussi me taraude l'esprit : il serait astucieux d'introduire des parchemins r√©cuper√©s soit sur des √Æles , soit sur des b√¢teaux √† la d√©rive (collecte qu√™te). Autre id√©e : j'ai pens√© avec une collecte de bois pour le craft qu'il serait tr√®s int√©ressant de crafter un ponton pour p√™cher en toute qui√©tude (bois , cordage "fibres" et autres...).
Pourquoi ne pas introduire un myst√©rieux personnage qui viendrait mettre sa tante sur une √Æle mais uniquement √† certaines heures de la journ√©e ou de la nuit , on serait tr√®s content de le croiser (rare) pour lui acheter de nouveaux livres (extension craft).
Introduire un homme pirate avec un crochet √† la main (Boss) ou on looterait un hame√ßon en forme crochet√© pour la p√™che (loot bleu 2% de chance d'√™tre consomm√©).
Introduire un homme pirate avec une proth√®se √† la jambe (Boss) ou on looterait une √©p√©e (proth√®se) rare avec des caract√©ristiques de combat.

Introduction de PNJs avec un pickaxe , une canne √† p√™che , un arc √† la main nous demandant de remplir certains conditions (leur ramener ce qu'ils veulent)
Introduction d'un PNJ bloqu√© sur une √Æle nous demandant de lui trouver son b√¢teau √©chou√©.
Application de fissures sur les falaises et massifs montagneux afin de justifier l'utilisation de bombes et pouvoir acc√©der √† des petites trouvailles.

Introduire de larges b√¢teaux pirates arr√™t√©s sur l'oc√©an , possibiliter de monter sur les b√¢teaux et combattre l'√©quipage avec un tr√©sor au bout et des cl√©s en or pour les ouvrir.
Introduire une jauge mentale pour la suite de l'aventure ne serait pas une mauvaise id√©e comme dans don't starve...
Introduire des insectes larges luminescents dans la nuit et looter une lampe rare qui serait fluo.
Introduire la possibilit√© de r√©cup√©rer du feuillage sur les arbres ou de la paille pour les futurs shelters (craft).
Introduire des banquises Nord-Sud avec des ours polaires - mode agressif .
Introduire des petits √©tangs au sommet d'√Æles rocheuses pour y p√™cher des objets uniques.
Introduire des essaims d'abeilles dans les for√™ts.

Parvenir √† mettre en √©vidence une ou deux √Æles volcaniques (lave) avec une interaction et des loots sur place.
Penser √† √©tablir un puzzle qui reconstituerait un immense pilier qui sortirait de l'eau avec une surprise au bout.
Introduire dans le futur shelter une possibilit√© de stocker son mat√©riel et de se vider par la m√™me occasion du surplus de son inventaire.
Introduire dans le futur shelter un genre de barbecue pour cuire ses poissons et sa viande avec un bonus en combat ou faire cuire directement ses aliments avec un feu de camp.

Possibilit√© de se reposer dans le shelter et de faire passer le temps plus rapidement.
Possibilit√© de r√©cup√©rer des fossiles rares √† travers l'exploration (pnj qu√™te)
A partir de certains fossiles et os recuper√©s sur certains rivages : crafter des colliers faits de fossiles ou d'os.
Possibilit√© de crafter des coffres √† l'int√©rieur de son b√¢teau pour stocker du mat√©riel (maiden ship)
Eventuellement on pourrait croiser des pirates arm√©s et ils nous tireraient dessus √† distance ce qui nous obligerait √† adopter un sch√©ma plus tactique pour le combat.
Ce serait cool de pouvoir obtenir une plume (encre) dans le jeu et crafter du papier ou parchemin pour y mettre des notes , des informations.
Les vagues doivent pousser le bateau et ne pas le laisser au m√™me point de la carte ainsi que le vent , possibilit√© de crafter une ancre afin que le b√¢teau ne puisse plus bouger du tout ou d√©river.

Int√©grer plus de myst√®re lors des phases de nuit pour rajouter de la difficult√© au jeu.
Int√©grer des chapeaux √† nos pirates afin de les leur r√©cup√©rer (loot rare).
Int√©grer du brouillard , de la pluie et un temps nuageux par moment serait davantage int√©ressant.

A chaque fois que l'on p√™che , il fait int√©grer la possibilit√© qu'il existe des ratages (% de loot 0) (sinon √ßa serait trop facile).
Gagner un peu moins d'argent lors des fouilles des cadavres (pirates) pour que les achats avec les pnj soient plus difficiles , √©tablir des prix tr√®s √©lev√©s pour la vente d'objets.
Supprimer la nourriture que l'on trouve dans les coffres et ne pas mettre automatiquement de la nourriture qd un animal est tu√© (% de loot)
Il existe des √Æles ou il n'y a aucun danger , rem√©dier √† cela car on ne perd pas assez de vie.
Lorsque la jauge de faim est au plus bas , la barre de vie devrait diminuer en temps normal.
R√©cup√©ration d'oeufs d'oiseaux nich√©s dans les arbres (qu√™te).
R√©cup√©ration de divers champignons sur le continent pour une qu√™te unique.
R√©cup√©ration de langues de serpents pour crafter un lance-pierre par exemple avec le stock de pierre qui diminuerait...
Introduire des barques √©chou√©es sur le rivage.
Enfin derni√®re id√©e : pourquoi ne pas r√©cup√©rer des pi√®ces flottantes mises un peu partout dans l'oc√©an? une autre qu√™te qui ne serait pas d√©nu√©e d'int√©r√™t...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960269579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1516525413}
review:
Having been burned by Early Access games in the past I was hesitant to buy into Salt. Making a freely available demo is probably one of the smartest moves I've seen in a while from a small developer, as experiencing the gameplay turned my 'maybe' into a sale. 

The developers are incredibly responsive within the Steam discussion forum and listen to player input and suggestions. They do not seem to be trying to cash in and genuinely want to make a fun game for people to play. I wish more developers would follow in their style.

As far as the gameplay, it's a 'light' survival game with great colors and scenery. Sailing is an element which in my opinion is underutilized and the random generation of islands provides great potential.

'Great Potential' is essentially how I would summarize this game currently. Since the world is randomly generated from a seed it can be rather expansive but right now content and gameplay components may be found to be somewhat thin. I feel this is due to the true 'early access' nature of the title as new content comes with nearly every patch.

If you're curious at all about a survival and exploration game set in a beautiful environment, check out the demo. Check out the discussion forums. I suspect you'll purchase once you experience a taste of Salt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064482227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 12664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1759, 'last_played': 1597801561}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041791816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3828, 'last_played': 1464498548}
review:
This is a very enjoyable exploration/survival game, I can't wait for multiplayer to be released.

The graphics may be a bit cartoonish but in my opinion they seem great to add an atmospheric touch.  I love the music, and I agree with others who say that sunset and sunrise are amazing.

I like the moon phasing and the fact that it has its own cycle that osn't dependant on the sun, I hope in a future release it will have a purpose.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972437090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 5066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2643, 'last_played': 1510035659}
review:
This game is good therapy.

Seirously, it is.  There is a game to play, stuff to fight, better stuff to get, boss enemies to fight and so on.  But what really strikes me about this game is just how it stands out of the sandbox crowd for it's unique approach to the genre.  Light is always playing with the flora, land and water,  creating a neverending kaleidoscope of coloramas.

While some may complain about the cartoonish style of the graphics, they compliment the game perfectly.  The ability to sail around in boats obtain better and bigger boats adds to the already bountiful list of things to do.

In short, if you are looking for a very relaxed, but very well made exploration game that doesn't pressure you with timers etc,  and want to just take in the amazing sunlight effects now and then,  look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037006295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1699801360}
review: First off, this game is beautiful. It is smooth and well polished, even in the UI. The sun/moon and lighting effects are stunning. That being said, it seems to me that at the moment it's very lacking in content. Worth playing? Without a doubt if devolpment continues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072932385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1487569437}
review:
This is a unique, open-ocean-world survival game.

It's a lot of fun for this stage in development, even with the simple placeholder graphics. Scavenging for resources, hunting for food or picking out pirates to murder. It's great to just fish from the side of a pirate ship or sail off into open ocean looking for a new island to explore. This is a game to keep an eye on, it's got a bright future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127150380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1444085936}
review:
there it was! the moonstone rock I had been looking for forever! it was a dark moonless night so it was completly dark, I approched the moonstone ore and took out my pick and started to nibble away.......then.....Out of the dark jumped out a huge spider and hit me putting out my torch. It was attacking me left and right and it was pitch black, but after i lit my torch again, it was gone. 

This is just a little tale of the monsters you can "incounter" 

let us seperate this info into "pros" and "cons" eh?

CONS:

CON: I have found in this game that it is very creepy, just the games shaders get you heart pumping in a few min after the sunset.

CON: the game has a view bugs that are pretty anoying.

pretty much for the consXD

PROS:

PRO: Brings back the classic mysterous survival aspect that minecraft and other games have lost over time

PRO: unlimited terrain so no end in adventure!!!

PRO: amazing sunsets and terrain generating which really make the game more adventerous 

pretty much for this review! worth the money! 9/10! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198044483486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1583655254}
review:
If you like exploring with minimal encounters with anything to fight and you need something to calm you down.....well i recomend this game even though it consists of mainly sailing around the world, exploring, and finding new equipment and enemies...AND FISH!!!!!
Fighting on the other hand is simple just have a strong sword and some basic armor and sit in front of the guy and hit him...the only enemies i found difficult are the captains which can take some hits before they go down but otherwise it's relaxing especially if your listening to some music or maybe your favorite podcast

13/10 buy it

author: {'steamid': '76561198042654404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1515772626}
review:
Before reading on, I thoroughly suggest you download the demo for this game (available above) before investing money into it. It's early access and by no means near completeion, thus making it's price of ¬£11 quite a gamble.

My experience with the demo was fulfilling as someone who's looking for something calm, peaceful, and relaxing to play. Although mush of the game's content is missing from the demo (not surprising), it allowed me to get an insight into what the game has to offer me as of now, and what it may offer in the future.

It was satisfying to control my raft as I sailed across the waves between islands, and - aside from the simple, yet altogether beautiful, graphics - felt very immersive. 

My first encounter with an enemy, a pirate carrying a sword, was interesting - the combat in this game is simple and predictable, and provides users with the typical "attack", "powerful attack", and "block" features present in most games of this nature. Impressively, the combat in this game, although sometimes predictable (the enemy I fought only had one single attack) was an enjoyable quick break from the usual serenity of the rest of the game. Hunting, similarly, gives a small sense of achievement, and the rewards follow suit.

The scenery is very eyecatching and I have taken lots of screenshots of this game already, from the vast valleys in the islands to my boat drifting on the surf. There are substantial amounts of graphical settings which allows this game to be played on a wide variety of machines (and on high settings, I can safely say that I am impressed with what the graphics of this game has to offer).

Crafting in the game is easy and simple, as well as logical, and there's a decent variety of crafting recipies already. Like most games, there is a slight learning curve (not just in crafting, but in respect to the whole game), which serves as a little challenge for new players.

There is lots of content in the game already, which is surprising considering how new it is. The developers have promised future updates, however having had the game for such little time I can't vouch for them. Any improvements I'd like to see in the game are very likely to be added in the future.

Altogether, I find no bad points to make against this game. It does what is promised, and providing the developers stay faithful to their noteworthy creation, my rating of 10/10 shall stay as it is.

Please, before you purchase this game, do your own research. As with all early access games (and this game is VERY early access) you're paying for what a developer has promised you. I must say that the current game content is not worth ¬£11 - what the developers say they will be adding, however, works out as quite a good deal for ¬£11. Early access games are a gamble for the consumer, and this provides no deviation from that. Purchase with care.

I, myself, am glad to be a part of this game's development, and will be eagerly participating on the forums.

10/10. Let's hope it stays that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059134388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1988, 'last_played': 1538262934}
review:
The demo as far as I could tell is just the game in a confined space, so I suggest getting the demo and trying it out.

 One of the great things about this game is how the devs are very interactive (look at the discussions) with the players. It is also highly replayable since the main goal is exploration-even if you are trying to get the same things again the journey to those items will be different everytime. Of course there is also fishing, searching for loot and secrets or merchants, finding various tree fruits, hunting, gathering materials like wood and stone, etc.

The graphics for this game don't seem very good initially, but in reality they are fantastic. When you are actually playing they turn out to provide a very islandy tropical feeling. Even the balloon shaped pirates (of which there are different types) turn out to be nice. Also sounds are great - Crickets chirping, birds in the morning and after, ocean waves near the beach...   

Another thing is farther you get from land the bigger the waves get, which is just a nice little touch to have. 

10/10 best 15$ game you can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050833063', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1597035891}
review: Awesome game! Super relaxing, the sense of a vast, living world and you as a little speck really come to life here. The merchant is a cheat though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065102328', 'num_games_owned': 985, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1490066311}
review:
Salt's Early Access has been one of the more interesting survival games I've played lately. I personally have grown tired of the Zombie Survival games out there and Salt brings back a more realistic and exploring feeling without all the zombies. Although you may encounter a random giant spider sometimes, it's definitely not hard to kill and they don't lag around in any way. You will have to fight off pirates as well on certain islands, but there aren't hordes of them and escaping from them is usually pretty easy by just running back to your boat.  There are a couple different kinds of boats you can craft to get you to the several islands all different from eachother. Some having abundances of food and materials while others house pirates and other threats, you might even stumble upon some ancient ruins and find a nice simitar or sword. You may also stumble upon a pirate ship floating out in the ocean. These require some maintenece to repair and get working again and also hold a locked chest with valuble loot inside. Killing a pirate Captain granted me a key and I was able to access the chest in the ship but from what I have read you can get these keys sometimes from regular pirates or if you happen to come across a merchant, you can trade or buy one from him. It's the only thing thats really useful that they sell at the moment, The other stuff can be found quite easily. The worlds are created via seeds and anyone using the same seed will experience the same generated world. You must hunt and scavenge for food in order to keep yourself alive while sailing from island to island. Getting lost is probably one of the easiest things to do in this game especially if you have a urge to explore a lot like I do as exploration plays a huge role in Salt. Take note of the different types of Pirates you encounter. One I found to be really useful was the Cartographer Pirate.  Upon killing and looting his body I was able to get my hands on a compass which really made things a lot easier when it came to navigating the almost identical looking islands. The game is single player only which is one thing that bummed me out a bit as I would love to be able to explore this world with a friend, but it is still very interesting. As far as graphics go, The art syle is great, the textures and models aren't that impressive until you see a sunrise or sunset which can really make things look beautiful. Overall the game looks very promising for its future and I will definitely continue playing this. The developers are very active with the community in the forums and I see them replying to almost every post which is what we all love to see with these Early Access games. I definitely reccomend picking this game up if you like Survival and Exploration games. You won't be dissapointed. 
Please take note. This early access and there will be bugs. Don't purchase unless you understand this. 
I give thee a rating of 8/10 and can't wait to see the stuff added in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045787676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1537130967}
review: So far, I've taken more pictures in this game than any other. Exploring has never been so much fun, with a fun sailing mechanic and tons of things to discover. Combat could use some work, but it's not the focus. SALT is fun, though I am confused as to why it is not called Sail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072931989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8504, 'last_played': 1564963261}
review:
If you like survival games with beautiful places, large areas exploration, fishing, hunting and some combat, definitely buy this awesome masterpiece of the gaming creation art! You can explore an entire world with sea and islands, searching for resources, food and a way to go home, but while you walk across the game's rich landscapes, you will occasionally encounter some pirates.
I downloaded the demo only to evaluate the game, but when I started to play it, I simply couldn't stop; I played it for many hours ininterruptly.
I strongly reccomend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059502502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1414463329}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029043678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1693371230}
review:
Updated! - They really need to incorporate Co-op mode whether its hotseat or online it has to be there! The game needs to be played with friends with a save mode so you both can return to your game later. 

The developers are constantly improving 'Salt' so you can count on new updates being released regularly. This is my go to game when I feel the need for adventure and exploration. Permadeath can suck but each turn is always different and the loot you find varies! 

I have a lot of survival and exploration games and lately I haven't been too excited about any of the early access or new releases. That changed completely when I saw 'Salt' enter early access. I knew, from the videos and description, that this was going to be a great game.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Good Features
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
1. Island and sea exploration using rafts and boats.
2. A beautiful sea and island world with a day and night cycle with great potential!
3. RPG elements when looking at weapons and armor / crafting etc..
4. Crafting system
5. Hunger system
6. Hunting and Fishing
7. hostile islands with pirates
8. smooth first person controls
9. Great ocean design
10. Quests received from Merchants!
11. Sunsets/sunrises
12. Minimal graphics
13. Not cpu or GFX heavy
14. Great fun if you like exploring, finding new loot, crafting and sailing.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I will continue to play this game as it develops. It has great potential and I believe in the team designing it. This will be awesome  :>

I recommend 'Salt' to anyone who likes survival, exploration, crafting(collecting materials), quests, relaxing while sailing, enjoying sunsets sunrises nature and the open sea. The waves can get quite rocky out there, its fun.

Much love
Kristoffer

author: {'steamid': '76561198017563282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1470162194}
review:
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW 19/10/2014

Let me start of this review by saying that this is one of, if not, my favotite game of this year. Why? Because it's unique and takes a very simple concept that alot of people have wanted for a long time and makes it fun and enjoyable even in its early stages.

----Gameplay----
The gameplay of the game is similar to games like 'Minecraft' where you gather items and craft them although this isn't a voxel game so don't expect any digging. You start with nothing and have to gather wood and plant fibers from around your little island to make equipment but you don't have to look too far as somewhere on your island will spawn a chest that gives you the essential items to build a small raft which you can use to explore other islands.

---Combat---
The games combat system is currently buggy and not great but for early stages it works ok, it's your basic left click attack and right click block or for items such as the dagger left click is another attack. You can dodge which is something you should do often as they do do quite a bit of damage and without a good weapon they will lower your health fast before you can lower theirs.

---Sailing---
The one key aspect of this game which makes the game what it is. It's simple, you hold 'E' on the wheel or paddle and use the mouse to steer manually, you will have to recenter yourself if the waves knock your ship or if the wheel/paddle isn't straight.

---Crafting---
Currently all I know of the crafting is the basic guide you are given at the start which gives you essential things such as Clubs, rafts and other items so I can't comment on how much you can craft but I have found few things not on their such as the compass.

---Other Things---
Across the vast ocean you will come across broken ships which you will need to repair in order to use them and on the ship are chests which you can open if you have a key which can be obtained via pirates on islands, you can also obtain gold for merchants off them. I believe you will find 1 pirate per campfire so be warned if you see quite a few. 1 Variation of a pirate are the 'Pirate Captains' which are more powerful and have more health so be warned. There are also wildlife such as deer on the islands and their meat replenish alot of hunger. There are also merchants but I am currently unsure of their wereabouts.

---Things I hope will be in it---

Multiplayer: Obviously, who doesn't want to sail across the vast ocean with their crew, maybe even mmo type servers with PVP.

Workshop: Maybe have a character creator for online similar to Minecraft. Maybe even custom worlds and stories.

More Items: The more items the better!

More Ships: The more ships the better!

---Conclusion---
This is a must buy game for survival and pirate lovers as it truly is a great game.
I give the game a 9/10 for being fun, unique and really well thoughtout.

---YouTube---
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aO7tW_s6Mpo

author: {'steamid': '76561198015539882', 'num_games_owned': 3125, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1413728555}
review:
As of 19 Oct 2014:
Salt is a game about exploring randomly generated islands. 
It offers almost purely exploration gameplay. And for some reason it is extremely captivating (maybe because I love exploring).
The graphics are not too impressive, but from time to time you can find some nice scenery (sunsets and sunrises are pretty awesome too).
There is hunting, although at the moment there are only deers to hunt. There is fishing, but I'd found just roaming around to be way more fun. 
There is trading, you can actually stumble upon merchants and sell the things you don't need, or buy something you want. Although, so far they wasn't too useful.
There is combat, but it's pretty basic (think minecraft style of doing things).
And then, there's Exploration. Where you can just spend countless hours roaming around the seas and poking around different islands to find another chest, or another fancy item laying around. It's very, very fun (again, if love exploring).
Upcoming quests, new biomes and other cool things will only make it better.

On the downsides: 
- combat is way to simplistic and could use a bit more depth (again, it's not the main thing in the game as I already said).
- graphics are still quite glitchy on some GPUs (but devs are aware and fix is coming soon)
- UI is not the best one out there (especially if you are playing on a large screen/have bad eyesight)
- controls for boat could use some refinement

More detailed look in the video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cp2fQYIFYWk

review:
We all love survival games and it takes something unique to make each one stand out from the crowd.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXWUWlB4UTg
Salt stands out from the crowd. - You're no longer stuck on that deserted island, in Salt you can craft yourself boats of various designs and seek out new islands of discovery. This game is clever into making you think and play like a pirate, becuase along the way you encounter quite a few of them. It's has superb visuals and the crafting system is simply and very easy to understand. - Aharrrr mateys! < i'm not very good at pirate talk. - Good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024769038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1514177138}
review:
Such a peaceful game,
you make your first raft, sail to another peaceful island, get some more resources.
Maybe you kill a deer, or you might just stay peaceful and pick some apples,
you eventually get enough resources to make a better boat, so you take it for a spin, then sit out there, in the ocean, and fish, watching the sunset.
You decide to rest for the night, so you find an island and sleep. As you wake you explore this new island, while you gather apples, you notice a sound and OH SHIT THERE ARE MOTHER FU*KING PIRATES!!!!! DIE BITCH DIE!!! IL BASH YOU WITH MY CLUB!!!!!
You hide on your boat, watching them wait for you to return to the shore, 
You gather up your resources, make a bow, then shoot the MOTHER FU*KERS WHO ATTACKED YOU!!!!!!!!! YEH I GOT A SWORD NOW ASSHOLE!!!!! HOW DO YOU LIKE ME NOW!!!!!!!!! AH HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH!!!!!!!!!!!! I WILL FEAST ON YOUR BRAINS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

-note, game does not contain brain feasting-

author: {'steamid': '76561198139329099', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1516885699}
review:
[h1]Minecraft meets Wind Waker 8.5/10[/h1]

Al ser un juego de acceso anticipado me es muy dif√≠cil calificarlo, en Salt despiertas en una isla desierta, con solo una nota acerca de lo que tienes que hacer. Recolectar suministros en la isla y junto con los materiales del cofre crear un bote, con un dise√±o gr√°fico bastante bueno para ser acceso anticipado (a excepci√≥n de los PNJs) el juego tiene potencial de ser a√∫n mejor.
Un vasto oc√©ano con miles de islas por explorar en 3 tipos diferentes de botes (se a√±adir√°n m√°s en la versi√≥n final) con multitud de materiales y objetos diferentes que puedes Crear/Comprar/Encontrar en los diferentes lugares que visitas, a falta de un objetivo por completar excepto explorar todas las islas el juego tiene contenido para mantenerte jugando por horas.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
-Un sistema intuitivo de creaci√≥n y descubrimiento.
-Miles de islas por explorar con cientos de cosas por hacer.
-La versi√≥n final a√±adir√° misiones, diferentes barcos y diferentes climas.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
-El dise√±o de los personajes es bastante malo respecto a el resto del juego.
-Los PNJs y animales presentan una especie de "Bug" al moverse o intentar huir.
-Hacen falta m√°s objetos o un "libro de recetas" m√°s completo.

[h1]Conclusi√≥n:[/h1] Si hay un juego en acceso anticipado que vale la pena comprar ese es "Salt" pues a pesar de los min√∫sculos errores que el juego presenta tiene muchos m√°s aciertos, especialmente tomando en cuenta que estar√° en acceso anticipado hasta mediados del 2015, tiene bastante potencial y como manera de pasar varias horas y divertirse, Vale la pena.

An√°lisis basado en una copia digital del juego para Steam, facilitada por el equipo de LavaBoots.

review: If you've ever played Stranded II, this is what you've been waiting for. A survival game focused on exploration, no zombies, low conflict, just you and the environment. It's simple in its current state but we really need more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094054846', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1512864075}
review: WOW  This game is Amazing. And its only starting. I started playing this game before it was on steam and i fell iin love with it when i was still playing the free trail demo. The adventures and the stunning views you will meet will make it so worth while , so much loot to plunder already and its nothing yet , so much fish too fish and so much plants to harvest , pirates to kill and deers to hunt , boats and ships to build and survive the nights next to a camp fire looking over the horizon looking at your ship tht you just discovered and repaired, ride the seas and ride the waves , huddle inside the cabin of the ship while the storm has passed or fight it of on deck and risk getting kicked of board and back to ur raft. The decision is up to you , you are the captain of your adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993347349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1420133983}
review:
WOW!
Coming from someone who has bought almost every survival early access game in search of the perfect one. I think I finally found it. Who could have thought that a game this engrossing could only be 66MB? 

If you want a survival game that does not have zombies and instead focuses on actually surviving, do yourself a favor and drop the money on this. 

I was very skeptical as the videos seemed like frame rate was choppy. The game is actually very smooth and fluid. The videos didn't display the great foraging and crafting. From the time I booted it up I could not stop playing this. Sure there is a learning curve but you aren't worried about someone sniping you in the back while you try to figure out how to build a fire.

I am in awe. This is no fanboy review; I just bought it on a whim tonight. VERY PLEASED!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002734128', 'num_games_owned': 3358, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1464538777}
review:
First Impressions: 

I had an interesting first experience in that my ship went flying off into the sunset (see the video below), but stuff like that happens in Alphas/Betas so I'm not too worried about it (the game isn't expected to leave Early Access until Fall of 2015). The game does have some growing to do obviously, but I like the idea of exploring a bunch of islands and seeing what all there is to see.  It's one of the reasons I'm so hooked on "Planet Explorers".  Will most certainly revisit to see what else the game has to offer and am looking forward to future updates.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8WUYiTJAhC4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lqLYSyxuO7s

author: {'steamid': '76561198112981059', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 4862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4763, 'last_played': 1627313769}
review:
wow...this is such a nice game to play.
Sail from island to island,finding things you need to survive, craft your weapons and tools and hunt deer for food,also fight strange looking pirates and maybe steal there ship and you can go fishing.
And the Music is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023452686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1438749441}
review:
This is just one of those games I'll say to just 'buy it, buy it now'. 
It has the adventure that games like "minecraft" (And other crafting/surviving games) are so badly missing. 
Theres only a tiny bit of hand holding to get you started, then your on your own. Some people might cry about it, but its about perfect for most. Takes a few minutes to get your barings, but theres not much you can't figure out after that.
Crafting system is fairly limited at the moment, but early access and all that jazz.
As it stands right now October 2014, its a very playable game. Combat is bare bare bones, but again, it works.

So to sum it up-
Positives
Fun ocean adventure
island exploring
crafting & light mining
combat (with pirates!)
sailing
hunting elk
worlds can be random generated
game runs very well on my mid grade laptop
no one telling you how to play or where to go
the dev seems (so far ((My opinion)) ) like a decent person who wants to make a great community involved game. 

Negitive ...
Basic bare bones combat
not a lot of crafting (yet)


Thats about it. They have a great demo, give it a try. The demo itself, could be relased as a small game on its own and be better than a lot of the other early access games.
So take it from me, 
a 30 year old man with a beard, 
I strongly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984441958', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1502278226}
review:
Have sunk dozens of hours in to this game before it eventually came to Steam. All the standard early access warnings and caveats apply, but it's a remarkably solid game even at this early stage.
Try the demo and see if it's to your liking. The full game is more of it, expanded over hundreds of islands. 
The devs are very active and willing to take suggestions and are constantly implementing new features and ideas.
I've thrown a lot of money at a lot of early access titles, but this has easily given me the most enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056839295', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1529823958}
review: Do you like survival games and exploration?  Yes? Stop reading this and buy Salt right now.  I've played and followed many different survival games and none come close to the enjoyment I get from this game.  It's one of the few early access titles that will provide you with a fully enjoyable experience right from the get go.   It's also one of the few survival games that genuinely feel different from the rest.  If you like fun environments, emergent story telling and rpg loot systems, then you have found the perfect game....seriously.  Buy Salt...Now...GO....DO IT!  :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198001748570', 'num_games_owned': 1499, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1468353925}
review:
Played this many hours before it was available on steam, when it was being sold on their website (24hr +)

The game is all about exploration, adventure, and discovering the game's world mysteries, and less so on survival (but it is still there)

You start off on an island with nothing, where you collect all the resources you need survive and start your journey, and by 'start your journey' i mean make a nice little charming raft so you can set sail to explore the seas and check out other islands for to gather more resources to craft even better items like an actual boat, or a glowing moon rock sword, and not just gather resources but also search for and unravel the games bysteries and secrets to learn more of the game's lore, and get nice rare ancient items.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YG2RgulTmXg

You will also encounter pirates and animals and hostile creatures that you can attack for either getting better armor/weapons, meat to eat, or items to help you craft a new item (or a ship.. but won't spoil that for you ;) )

The only bad thing about the game so far is the melee combat, you could say it's bare bones basic, and needs a lot of work.

The game is an exploration adventure game in it's purest beautiful form, and will say it's hands down the best game that does it best, with mysteries to look out for, and a since of wonder when look at a distant land.

'Shameless' More info [url=http://www.ksalue.com/_/game-shock/game-shock-salt-alpha-preview-r572]here[/url]
